  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* A dictionary data structure implemented as skip lists
  19.    (see William Pugh, "Skip lists: a probabilistic alternative to
  20.    balanced binary trees", Comm. ACM 33(6), 1990). */

  22. #include <stddef.h>
  23. #include "caml/config.h"
  24. #include "caml/memory.h"
  25. #include "caml/misc.h"
  26. #include "caml/skiplist.h"

  28. /* Size of struct skipcell, in bytes, without the forward array */
  29. #if (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L)
  30. ‌#define SIZEOF_SKIPCELL sizeof(struct skipcell)
  31. #else
  32. ‌#define SIZEOF_SKIPCELL (sizeof(struct skipcell) - sizeof(struct skipcell *))
  33. #endif

  35. /* Generate a random level for a new node: 0 with probability 3/4,
  36.    1 with probability 3/16, 2 with probability 3/64, etc.
  37.    We use a simple linear congruential PRNG (see Knuth vol 2) instead
  38.    of random(), because we need exactly 32 bits of pseudo-random data
  39.    (i.e. 2 * (NUM_LEVELS - 1)).  Moreover, the congruential PRNG
  40.    is faster and guaranteed to be deterministic (to reproduce bugs). */

  42. ‌static uint32_t random_seed = 0;

  44. ‌static int random_level(void)
  45. {
  46.   uint32_t r;
  47.   int level = 0;

  49.   /* Linear congruence with modulus = 2^32, multiplier = 69069
  50.      (Knuth vol 2 p. 106, line 15 of table 1), additive = 25173. */
  51.   r = random_seed = random_seed * 69069 + 25173;
  52.   /* Knuth (vol 2 p. 13) shows that the least significant bits are
  53.      "less random" than the most significant bits with a modulus of 2^m,
  54.      so consume most significant bits first */
  55.   while ((r & 0xC0000000U) == 0xC0000000U) { level++; r = r << 2; }
  56.   CAMLassert(level < NUM_LEVELS);
  57.   return level;
  58. }

  60. /* Initialize a skip list */

  62. ‌void caml_skiplist_init(struct skiplist * sk)
  63. {
  64.   int i;
  65.   for (i = 0; i < NUM_LEVELS; i++) sk->forward[i] = NULL;
  66.   sk->level = 0;
  67. }

  69. /* Search a skip list */

  71. ‌int caml_skiplist_find(struct skiplist * sk, uintnat key, uintnat * data)
  72. {
  73.   int i;
  74.   struct skipcell ** e, * f;

  76.   e = sk->forward;
  77.   for (i = sk->level; i >= 0; i--) {
  78.     while (1) {
  79.       f = e[i];
  80.       if (f == NULL || f->key > key) break;
  81.       if (f->key == key) {
  82.         *data = f->data;
  83.         return 1;
  84.       }
  85.       e = f->forward;
  86.     }
  87.   }
  88.   return 0;
  89. }

  91. ‌int caml_skiplist_find_below(struct skiplist * sk, uintnat k,
  92.                              uintnat * key, uintnat * data)
  93. {
  94.   int i;
  95.   struct skipcell ** e, * f, * last = NULL;

  97.   e = sk->forward;
  98.   for (i = sk->level; i >= 0; i--) {
  99.     while (1) {
  100.       f = e[i];
  101.       if (f == NULL || f->key > k) break;
  102.       last = f;
  103.       e = f->forward;
  104.     }
  105.   }
  106.   if (!last) {
  107.     return 0;
  108.   } else {
  109.     *key = last-> key; *data = last->data; return 1;
  110.   }
  111. }

  113. /* Insertion in a skip list */

  115. ‌int caml_skiplist_insert(struct skiplist * sk,
  116.                          uintnat key, uintnat data)
  117. {
  118.   struct skipcell ** update[NUM_LEVELS];
  119.   struct skipcell ** e, * f;
  120.   int i, new_level;

  122.   /* Init "cursor" to list head */
  123.   e = sk->forward;
  124.   /* Find place to insert new node */
  125.   for (i = sk->level; i >= 0; i--) {
  126.     while (1) {
  127.       f = e[i];
  128.       if (f == NULL || f->key >= key) break;
  129.       e = f->forward;
  130.     }
  131.     update[i] = &e[i];
  132.   }
  133.   f = e[0];
  134.   /* If already present, update data */
  135.   if (f != NULL && f->key == key) {
  136.     f->data = data;
  137.     return 1;
  138.   }
  139.   /* Insert additional element, updating list level if necessary */
  140.   new_level = random_level();
  141.   if (new_level > sk->level) {
  142.     for (i = sk->level + 1; i <= new_level; i++)
  143.       update[i] = &sk->forward[i];
  144.     sk->level = new_level;
  145.   }
  146.   f = caml_stat_alloc(SIZEOF_SKIPCELL +
  147.                       (new_level + 1) * sizeof(struct skipcell *));
  148.   f->key = key;
  149.   f->data = data;
  150.   for (i = 0; i <= new_level; i++) {
  151.     f->forward[i] = *update[i];
  152.     *update[i] = f;
  153.   }
  154.   return 0;
  155. }

  157. /* Deletion in a skip list */

  159. ‌int caml_skiplist_remove(struct skiplist * sk, uintnat key)
  160. {
  161.   struct skipcell ** update[NUM_LEVELS];
  162.   struct skipcell ** e, * f;
  163.   int i;

  165.   /* Init "cursor" to list head */
  166.   e = sk->forward;
  167.   /* Find element in list */
  168.   for (i = sk->level; i >= 0; i--) {
  169.     while (1) {
  170.       f = e[i];
  171.       if (f == NULL || f->key >= key) break;
  172.       e = f->forward;
  173.     }
  174.     update[i] = &e[i];
  175.   }
  176.   f = e[0];
  177.   /* If not found, nothing to do */
  178.   if (f == NULL || f->key != key) return 0;
  179.   /* Rebuild list without node */
  180.   for (i = 0; i <= sk->level; i++) {
  181.     if (*update[i] == f)
  182.       *update[i] = f->forward[i];
  183.   }
  184.   /* Reclaim list element */
  185.   caml_stat_free(f);
  186.   /* Down-correct list level */
  187.   while (sk->level > 0 &&
  188.          sk->forward[sk->level] == NULL)
  189.     sk->level--;
  190.   return 1;
  191. }

  193. /* Empty a skip list */

  195. ‌void caml_skiplist_empty(struct skiplist * sk)
  196. {
  197.   struct skipcell * e, * next;
  198.   int i;

  200.   for (e = sk->forward[0]; e != NULL; e = next) {
  201.     next = e->forward[0];
  202.     caml_stat_free(e);
  203.   }
  204.   for (i = 0; i <= sk->level; i++) sk->forward[i] = NULL;
  205.   sk->level = 0;
  206. }
